fields.description:
Notice the following rendering bug:

!strange_nav_state.png!

The "Create New Filter" should be on the next line. Here are some steps to get this:

# Create a filter shared globally.
# Logout.
# Open the filter as anonymous.
# Change the filter.
# Login in a user that does not own the filter.
# Goto issue navigator. You get the above screen.

I am sure there are easier steps to reproduce this.
fields.summary: Issue Navigator rendering glitch when 'Create New Filter' displayed.

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Create a user name having comma in it.
2. Now try to add the user in watch list or try to add the user to any group.

Result:
1. JIRA give error message.
2. Due to the comma in name, the user name is treated as two names and hence it failed when user try to add them in list.

Expected:
1. A better handling is required. Either the user name having comma is handled or we should not allow these in username
fields.summary: Having comma in username creates problem when user is added to a watch/group list

fields.description:
Navigator gives you the option to save a filter that you don't own if you change it. In 13.x it used to only present you with an option to "create a new filter".

# Share a filter.
# Login as different filter and edit the filter. 
# Goto "View" navigator mode. Notice that there will be an option to "Save The Filter".

We need to detect that the filter is not ours and not present invalid options to the user. I guess we lose ownership information when we clone the search request?
fields.summary: Navigator displays incorrect operations when changing a filter that you don't own.

* Having a stale index directory causes some weirdness.
## Start up JIRA. 
## Configure JIRA.
## Stop JIRA. Make the index directory readonly (I make the caches directory in JIRA_HOME read only)
## Restart JIRA. JIRA does not complain about the directory being invalid until you actually try to do some searching. Should be issue some warnings before hand?
## Goto the "Admin > Indexing". Note that indexing appears to be disabled.
## Reindex JIRA. I get the error message "Error occurred while activating indexes: com.atlassian.jira.util.RuntimeIOException: java.io.IOException: Cannot create directory: E:\blitz\home\caches\indexes\comments". fields.description:
When searching for issues in the issue picker, if someone enters a prefix that matches a lot (many thousands) of issue keys, this gets expanded by lucene into a query with thousands of terms. As this search is unsorted, it then tries to score it, creating a scorer per term. These scorers take up a lot memory (we saw 80MB for 40K issues) and are completely unnecessary as we will only ever match one issue key in the issue key field.

We need to implement a {{ConstantScorePrefixQuery}}, similar in design to Lucene's {{ConstantScoreRangeQuery}}.
fields.summary: IssuePicker ajax queries can use excessive memory

fields.description:
If one create a portlet from a shared filter and then the filter is being unshared or deleted,  on the user's dashboard an empty portlet with the header saying:
{quote}
Issues: ???
This portlet is not valid as the associated filter or field could not be retrieved. (Edit Portlet | Delete Portlet)
{quote}
is going to be displayed.

As per below example:

!before.png!

and after the filter is 'unshared'

!after.png!

Lack of feedback in the dashboard re reason why the portlet is not displayed correctly can be confusing for users (resulting in SAC cases). This problem might become apparent for users who used the filter for some time and are unaware of the change to the underling filter.

We could possibly display a message in the portlet saying 'Shared filter removed by xxxx'.
fields.summary: Provide feedback on dashboard when shared filter is deleted or unshared

fields.description:
When looking entitymodel.xml, it defines the field "security" in some domain models.
The word "security" is parsed as SQL reserved keyword on derby database.
I think that it seems derby bug. Perhaps old cloudscape might not occur it.

I reported this problem to Apache Derby project. For the detail, please open the following link:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/DERBY-4268
fields.summary: Database initialization is failed.

fields.description:
In JIRA with a single project the following can happen:

# Run an empty JQL query.
# Switch to the simple navigator. Notice that any custom fields with a context "project, ALL" will not display even though they should.
# Run the Query again in navigator. Notice that the custom fields appear.
# Switch back into advanced view. Notice that a "project" clause will be added.

This is caused as the simple issue navigator returns the only project using a hidden field. I think this behavior is around so that the "context" for a search can be correctly calculated and as such the correct searchers displayed. For instance, a custom filed with context "project, ALL" should always be displayed. However, this is currently also broken since the switch from "advanced" to "simple" will not show this custom field.
fields.summary: The single project behaviour of JQL and the Issue Navigator is not consistent.

fields.description:
Current wording in the section that lists dependency links for an issue(maybe it's been fixed in later versions?) is confusing because the phrased "depends on" and "is dependent on" mean exactly the same thing.

Better wording would be   
  "This issue  Depends on:"  (pretty much the same)
  "Issues that Depend on this:   (far clearer than 'This issue is dependent on")
fields.summary: linked issue dependency lables need better wording

fields.description:
After Summit we get a couple cases a day in SAC where users report problems re beta1.

The problems are related to:
- usage of the incompatible plugins,
- problems resulting from not following the upgrade documentation,

Moreover recently we've had a user who used the *pre-release* to upgrade his production JIRA (!) .

Despite that we can't force people to the right thing, we can make it much more obvious what is the purpose of this release and how it should be used.  Our customers aren't only tech people, but also users who 'click next, next and let see what happen' and those need more attention.

For e.g. we should:
# Link to the upgrade page tailored to the beta release on the download page. The same as for 'normal' JIRA release.
# Clearly state that this release is not  supported through SAC and all issues agains it should be reported in JAC.
# If we value feedback of less experienced users we should have a guide on what we want them to evaluate.
# Have warning in red - Do not use it for production installation.
# Have warning in red - Ensure that your plugins are suitable for the JIRA beta1

As the result of similar work on the Starter license we could benefit from lowering down number of support requests.
fields.summary: Improve documentation re purpose of installing and using JIRA 4.0 Beta 1

fields.description:
Most of our new users are intimidated by the number of actions/operations that are available for an Issue.  In most cases, they're only interested in Start Progress, Resolve, Assign, and Comment.

The new "Actions" field/list at least presents the many options cleanly, and only a click away.  However, *all* possibilites are offered.  It would be nice if, ideally on a per-project basis, an administrator could select just which ones are shown.

Barring the above, an alternative would be to allow the _ordering_ of the choices shown,  _and_ the placement of the horizontal line that separates the top few choices from those below.  Then, at least, we could tell most users to "just look at the choices *above* the line", while still providing convienient access to the lesser-used stuff (which would be *below* the line) for more advanced folks.
fields.summary: Make the new "Actions" field/list in 4.0 configurable

fields.description:
In 4.0 Beta1, the standard Show Saved Filter Portlet now allows you to specify which fields to show in the Portlet.  This is great, and seems to replicate the functionality of the "Show Saved Filter with Column" plugin that's available for 3.13.

However, it would be HUGE (IMHO) if that Portlet could also show the new "Actions" field (which allows the user to choose an action/operation from a drop-down list right from the view where it is shown, rather than having to click on the Issue and then click on an action/operation from the Issue view screen).

Then, from a single custom designed screen (the Portlet, which can be configured by the filter maker to show just the relevant fields), the user could could quickly Resolve, Reassign etc. without having to click on the Filter's name to get to a view with the handy Actions field available( and even at that point, you see what your Issue Navigator has been configured to show (not what the filter designer wanted)).

This would make for a much more simplifed view and process flow for most users.
fields.summary: Add the new 4.0 "Actions" field/list to the new standard Show Saved Filter Portlet field options

fields.description:
Currently if a query context contains any implicit contexts, it is determined to be too complex for the filter form.

However, it is possible for some searches that fit in the navigator to produce query contexts with implicit parts.

To reproduce:
1. Create a custom field with two contexts, one with Bug, and one with HSP.
2. Search for jql "proj = HSP and customfield = blah"
3. See that it does not fit into filter form when it should.
fields.summary: JQL Does it fit check does correctly check if a query context is too complex for the filter form

fields.description:
Version fields currently check if they imply more than one project, in which case they dont fit.

How ever this means if two projects have a version with the same name, that version name will never fit.
fields.summary: Version fields say they dont fit in filter form when they should

fields.description:
When a query generates a complex query, with at least two different possible contexts, then the jql select options util only retreives options from ONE of the contexts and not all.

To reproduce:

1. Create a multi select option custom field with two contexts.
2. first context should be set to only issue type bug and have options "1", "2"
3. Second option should be set to only project HSP and have options "2", "3"
4. Search for JQL "project = HSP and customfield in ("2", "3")
5. See that it doesn't fit even though it should.
fields.summary: Custom field options does not work with complex contexts

*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-17593].
{panel}
 

Couldn't seem to find a similar case so creating a new one.

We should use a progress bar similar to the reindex functionality for long running tasks such as running the integrity checker rather than just hanging and letting the browser potentially time out the connection.

It would be a better experience all around because you can then see that something is happening.
h3. Workaround

Access JIRA directly on a non-proxy connector, for example using the backdoor connector in [Integrating JIRA with Apache|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Integrating+JIRA+with+Apache], as this will not be timed out.
fields.summary: Use progress indicator for Integrity Checker to avoid a reverse-proxy timing out the request

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-17585].
  {panel}


JIRA uses a lot of images and hence a lot of image requests are made back to the server.  This has a cost!  A cost more than I think we realize.  

One examination of JAC logs shows that 25% of request by count and time are for images.  This is unexpected and worrying

Using CSS Sprites would be one way to alleviate some of this image serving load.

http://www.alistapart.com/articles/sprites

The FishEye team have used them with some sucess for 2.0 and we should too.


We have 173 icons in JIRA which are essentialy static.  These could all be made into sprites.

One complication is that icons for issue types of configurable.  However with an extra 2 fields we could make these sprite based as well.

For example issue type icons are currently forced in 16x16 image tags.   W could tweak the issue type definitions to be 

url :
x offset :
y offset"

And default then to be values for the 16x16 images.  However for JIRA supplied issue type icons, they could come from a supplied sprite strip and have x/y offset values that are appropriate.

IF customs are image savvy then they can also use image sprite strips but if they are not then its still works for a single image!

This is a non trivial to perform since there are so many places images are used however I suggest we sneak up on it over time, get the 80-20 rule images in place first and then update others as JIRA evolves.


I think there are some good performance wins to be made here!
fields.summary: Use CSS Sprites in the JIRA UI  for performance reasons!

fields.description:
The search query syntax uses OR as the default conjunction operator: "??The OR operator is the default conjunction operator. This means that if there is no Boolean operator between two terms, the OR operator is used.??"

This appears to be copied verbatim from the Lucene documentation: http://lucene.apache.org/java/2_3_2/queryparsersyntax.html and I'm assuming it's the Lucene default behaviour that's showing through in Jira.

We don't consider this to be a particularly useful default and would much prefer AND to be the default conjunction.  It seems very easy to ask Lucene to perform searches this way, so I was wondering whether Jira could be configurable to call Lucene that way?
fields.summary: Make default conjunction configurable in text searches

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-17528].
  {panel}

As an administrator, it would help with field re-use to have the Custom Field description set as part of the Custom Field context.

We use a JIRA as a general issue tracker, and use over 100 custom fields.  When re-using fields between projects, it would be helpful to have the Custom Field description be related to the Context (currently Global).  In this manner, the description can be set for different contexts as documentation specific to that project.

Example:

I have a custom field titled "Justification".  For project 1, the criteria for evaluating this field may be different than in project 2.  Setting a context specific description on each project would produce more accurate submissions from the end user.
fields.summary: Custom Field description should be context specific

fields.description:
When viewing an issue we add this issue to the history of viewed item for this user.

In IssueActionSupport we call  userHistoryManager.addIssueToHistory(remoteUser, issueObj);

Before the OfBizUserHistoryStore persists this history item to the database, it attempts to remove an history item for this issue.

If the user views an issue which is already part of the history, it leads to a delete and then an insert SQL operation. If the number of concurrent http requests is getting too high EntityEngine will fall over and not be able to create
valid primary keys for the history items. To fix this problem the remove and insert operation have to be synchronized, but this will cause Thread Contention.

Furthermore after inserting a new history item we select all history items for this user and delete history items if they exceeded the configured maximum (jira.max.history.items).
This also happens for almost every http request. Only if the user re-visits an issue which is already part of the history we skip this check.
fields.summary: OfBizUserHistoryStore not thread safe, but called from within webwork action
Improve logging in JIRA so the unecessary stack traces are not generated.

fields.description:
It would be great if on multi select lists, most importantly affects and fix version, for the selected valued to display next to the select list.  We've have many users at our company get confused when they go to edit an issue, they don't know what values are selected.  It would come in handy if next to a multi select list it displayed the selected values so that users can better gage what values are selected. 

This functionality should be added to:
* Affects Version
* Fix for Version
* Components
* Custom Fields using a multi select
fields.summary: Display selected values next to multi select lists.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-9306].

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, users who have a project with more than 1 Leader can't add multiple project lead into Jira projects.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow project administrators to add multiple Project Leads into a Jira Project. 

h3. Workaround
At this time there's no workaround.

fields.description:
We use apache2 as a frontend to confluence, jira, crowd. Users access the site using *https*, and we use apache's ProxyPass and ProxyPassReverse to forward requests to *ajp* connectors in confluence, jira, etc., (we use ajp because the jiraissues confluence macro does not work when using the http connector + ProxyPass)

This configuration works fine in jira 3.13.2.
However, in jira 4.0.0 beta1, the dashboard shows error messages for each gadget (see screenshot).

1) AJP connector
Apache configuration:
{noformat}
    ProxyPass /jira4 ajp://localhost:8111/jira4
    ProxyPassReverse /jira4 ajp://localhost:8111/jira4
{noformat}

Add ajp connector to jira's conf/server.xml:
{noformat}
        <!-- Define an AJP 1.3 Connector on port 8009 -->
            <Connector port="8111"
              enableLookups="false" redirectPort="8443" protocol="AJP/1.3" />
{noformat}

Errors in the log:

bq.2009-06-03 14:56:25,604 TP-Processor7 WARN [directory.internal.impl.GadgetSpecProviderDirectoryEntryProvider] Could not determine whether plugin-provided gadget spec store contains http://maxim-desktop:8181/jira4/rest/gadget/1.0/legacy/spec/com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.portlets:savedfilters.xml: URL is not a gadget spec URL for this server http://maxim-desktop:8181/jira4/rest/gadget/1.0/legacy/spec/com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.portlets:savedfilters.xml
bq.2009-06-03 14:56:25,606 TP-Processor8 WARN [directory.internal.impl.GadgetSpecProviderDirectoryEntryProvider] Could not determine whether plugin-provided gadget spec store contains http://maxim-desktop:8181/jira4/rest/gadget/1.0/legacy/spec/com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.portlets:projects.xml: URL is not a gadget spec URL for this server http://maxim-desktop:8181/jira4/rest/gadget/1.0/legacy/spec/com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.portlets:projects.xml

fields.description:
Steps:
- enter this advanced query: {{assignee != "test.user"}}
- switch to simple editing
- click "View": jira searches for assignee == "test.user"
- expected: jira should display a warning that the JQL query is "too complex to display in the Issue Navigator edit controls." Or better yet, provide a mechanism to use NOT in the "simple" Issue navigator edit controls. :)

If I use another form of the NOT operator, for example: {{NOT assignee = "test.user"}}
Then jira correctly displays a "too complex" warning if I try to switch to "simple" editing.
fields.summary: Invalid conversion from "advanced" to "simple" editing when JQL query contains "!="

fields.description:
Check out the attached image.

You can do this easily by:

# Creating a query that is not simple. For example, project = 10001 or issuetype in (1, 4).
# Running the query.
# Going to the URL {{secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?navType=simple}}

There are no links in JIRA that generate this URL. However, I have seen this same problem occuring when people just navigate around JIRA.
fields.summary: The Issue Navigator switch link can be inconsistent with the actual state of the navigator.

fields.description:
The issue navigator does not show the NEW pannel as being active for new search requests.

Follow these steps:

# Click "new" search on the issue navigator tabs.
# Click the "Issues" link in the menu.

Notice that none of the tabs are currently selected even though it is still a new search. There is no filter in the session, so it we change the navigator we will actually be generating a new search. 

NOTE: The current behavior is consistent with what JIRA 3.x did so we may not wish to fix this.
fields.summary: The issue navigator does not show the NEW pannel as being active for new search requests.

fields.description:
It would be nice if the JQL slow log was not in the main atlassian-jira.log. 

This may not be be useful in development, so maybe we need a development log4j and a production log4j like confluence does.
fields.summary: Put the JQL slow log into its own file.

fields.description:
This is a placeholder issue for the patch that prevents JRA-8009.

Under heavy load, it is possible that ActionContext thread local variable can get corrupted.  This can cause session information
to be cached when it should not be and can lead to invalid session exceptions at a latter time.

This patch ensures that the ActionContext Thread Local is completely cleared on request exit and that this corruption cannot occur.

The attached patch can be put onto any JIRA 3.13 version.
fields.summary: java.lang.IllegalStateException: getAttribute: Session already invalidated - Patch available

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-17512].
  {panel}

When the browser session times out, many parts of the Filter UI are still active.

The " View | Edit | New | Manage " tabs are all visible/clickable.
On the Manage tab the Popular filters are visible.
If you attempt to view a filter, the query fails and "No matching issues found." is returned.

Normally all these kind of actions would result in a reminder to login again.

To reproduce, leave a browser window on a filter page and let the session timeout.
Then click on one of the filter tabs and you'll see the odd behavior.
fields.summary: Filter UI still active after session times out.

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Launch JIRA and restore the projects from an XML file.
2. The XML file is having some projects having custom avatar associated to them.
3. The restore process went fine and no error message reported.
4. Login to JIRA instance and click on "Administration" tab 

Result:
1. There is stack trace in tomcat regarding the custom avatar file not found.
2. Complete stack trace attached.
3. Copying and pasting the avatar folder from JIRA_HOME will fix the issue.

Expected:
1. A proper warning message will be good rather then a stack trace.
2. Error handing should be there for issues which occur due to projects having custom avatar.
fields.summary: Restoring a XML file having projects with custom avatar associated give error if the avatar file is not copied to JIRA_HOME

fields.description:
Looking at the new methods in the SOAP API for the 4.0.0 beta1 there is one method that seems odd: getResolutionDateById(String token, Long issueId) 
Why would I want to use the Long issueid parameter for anything? Finding the issue id (as opposed to the issue key) is hard. What's the purpose of adding this method to the API?


Interface com.atlassian.jira.rpc.soap.JiraSoapService

Added Methods from 3.13.1 to 4.0.0 Beta1

boolean addBase64EncodedAttachmentsToIssue(String, String, String[], String[]) 	An alternative mechanism for adding attachments to an issue.
void deleteProjectAvatar(String, long) 	Deletes the given custom Avatar from the system.
RemoteIssue[] getIssuesFromFilterWithLimit(String, String, int, int) 	Returns issues that match the saved filter specified by the filterId.
RemoteIssue[] getIssuesFromTextSearchWithLimit(String, String, int, int) 	Returns issues containing searchTerms.
RemoteAvatar getProjectAvatar(String, String) 	Retrieves the current avatar for the given project.
RemoteAvatar[] getProjectAvatars(String, String, boolean) 	Retrieves avatars for the given project.
Date getResolutionDateById(String, Long) 	Given an issue id, this method returns the resolution date for this issue.
Date getResolutionDateByKey(String, String) 	Given an issue key, this method returns the resolution date for this issue.
void setNewProjectAvatar(String, String, String, String) 	Creates a new custom avatar for the given project and sets it to be current for the project.
void setProjectAvatar(String, String, Long) 	Sets the current avatar for the given project to that with the given id.
fields.summary: A SOAP API method using an issue id seems odd

fields.description: For the "Issues completed this iteration" gadget, if you don't have any unreleased versions, JIRA does not let you save the configuration. In my opinion, it should let you save it and have a message saying "No unreleased versions" rather than not let me save.

fields.description:
when adding users the email address is not 'trimmed'. This causes 'invisible' spaces in the email address and services which use email to match a valid user to fail.

Found this problem when looking into why our com.atlassian.jira.service.services.pop.PopService was using the default email and not the valid user email to identify who sent in the new issue comment.
fields.summary: Email addresses not 'trimmed' (blank spaces removed) when adding users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-17499].
  {panel}

By updating the security level over SOAP API, it is possible to set the value to an non-existing value or minimum not existing in the Security Scheme of the project.
Because of no validation the security level of the issue is set on a value at which either the soap user or anyone else has access to the issue after this update.

There should be an exception, if the security value is not valid for the security scheme of the project.
Maybe an excteption too, if the user is not a member of security level to be switched to.

This affects soap api of JIRA Enterprise Edition, Version: 3.9.1-#234 (updateIssue)
fields.summary: no validation for security level as valid option of security sheme - SOAP API

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login into JIRA. open the dashboard having some gadgets.
2. Keep the instance running in browser.
3. Now stop and start the JIRA server.
4. Try deleting the gadget from the already open JIRA dashboard.

Result:
1. On the logs there is java.lang.NullPointerException.
2. On UI it give user message "Sorry your changes to the dashboard can't be saved..."(Snapshot enclosed)

Expected:
1. A better handling.....no null pointer exception.
2. The user can be gracefully redirected to the login screen.
fields.summary: Trying to access dashboard(open from last instance) after user has restarted the server gives "Java null pointer exception"
